meanings.definition: Sophomores: students in their second year of high school or college
meanings.sent1: The sophs were excited to start their second year of college.
meanings.sent2: The sophs had to choose their major for the upcoming semester.
meanings.sent3: The sophs decided to form a study group to tackle their challenging courses together.
meanings.sent4: The sophs navigated the campus with more confidence this year.
meanings.sent5: The sophs organized a welcome party for the new freshmen.

meanings.definition: Sophisticated: having refined taste or manners
meanings.sent1: She wore a sophs dress to the elegant dinner party.
meanings.sent2: The restaurant had a sophs ambiance with soft lighting and classical music.
meanings.sent3: The cat looked quite sophs as it elegantly groomed itself.
meanings.sent4: His sophs taste in art was evident from the exquisite paintings in his home.
meanings.sent5: The sophs lady greeted everyone with a warm smile and impeccable manners.

meanings.definition: Sophistry: a clever but false argument
meanings.sent1: The politician's sophs tried to deceive the public with misleading statistics.
meanings.sent2: She saw through his sophs and refused to be swayed by his words.
meanings.sent3: The sophs of the con artist fooled many unsuspecting victims.
meanings.sent4: His sophs was so convincing that even the experts were momentarily swayed.
meanings.sent5: The sophs of the scam artist was finally exposed by a diligent investigator.
